basics.name: Sara Pour
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am a Computational Biologist and Data Scientist with a passion for the applications of machine learning in biology. I am currently a Ph.D. candidate in the department of Molecular Genetics, focussing on the sequence determinants of gene structure, primarily the 3' end.

education.area: Computational Genomics, Department of Molecular Genetics

highlights: Detected and analyzed the binding preferences and motifs in ChIP-seq data using machine learning techniques for over 30 proteins.

work.position: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Molecular Genetics
highlights: Assisted senior research associates and postdoctoral fellows with molecular biology experiments such as protein-binding microarray and SELEX to study the activity of RNA-binding proteins and transcription factors for identification of in vitro targets.

volunteer.summary: Helping new graduate and undergraduate students conduct research in bioinformatics
highlights: Helped to design and train deep-learning models for promoter-enhancer identification
Personally trained and supervised four students in successfully executing their projects

volunteer.summary: Providing low-income individuals and families with a three-day supply of groceries
highlights: Handing out a variety of dairy, eggs, and meats
Helping new community members register with us
Taking out the garbage, restocking, and cleaning up

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
